pullRequest.title: Bugfix: instructor dashboard button naming
pullRequest.bodyText:
Bugfix: fixed this bug #2084
Changed the naming of the button from "Instructor Dashboard" to "Instructor Course Dashboard" (English)
and from "Instruktor Dashboard" to "Instruktor Kurs Dashboard" (German)


Checklist

[ x] I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
[ x] Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
Fixes #2084
Also updates the translation for Instruktor -> Dozent for German language version
Description

Updated the respective .json files for German/English.
Steps for Testing

(screenshot below)

Log in to Artemis as a student or instructor
Navigate to Course Management
Check that the "Instructor Dashboard" button is renamed correctly as: "Instructor Course Dashboard" in German and English
Navigate to Course Management -> Instructor Course Dashboard -> Exercise Dashboard -> make sure Dozenten Kurs Dashboard in named correctly in German
Navigate to any exercise as an instructor -> at the top it should say Instructor actions. Confirm this is changed to  Dozentaktionen in German.
Navigate to Course Management -> Instructor Course Dashboard -> Exercise Dashboard -> make sure this correctly says Dozenten Ubungs-Dashboard.. in German
Try to test this error message: "There is currently no result for this quiz exercise, although the results have already been published. Please inform your instructor" make sure the text is correct in German.
Navigate to Course Management -> Exercises -> Teams (for an exercise with a team) ->  Create Team -> hover the Tutor tooltip: "Only instructors can re-assign tutors to teams." it should say "Nur Dozenten..." in German


Test Coverage


ExerciseService.java: n/a
programming-exercise.component.ts n/a

Screenshots

commit.message:
Bugfix: instructor dashboard button naming

Bugfix: fixed this bug #2084

nodes.bodyText:
Instruktor is not really used in German. Can we change it to Dozent (in this case it would be Dozenten which is plural) or to Kursleiter?
We would need to change this consistently in all places. I guess this PR would be a good opportunity ;-)
